title: Beef burgers with cheese filling

ingredients.content: 20 g oil, plus extra for frying
¼ tsp freshly ground black pepper
150 g Cheddar cheese or any other medium-hard cheese, cut into 8 pieces (3 x 3 cm, 5 mm thick)

preparations.content: Soften the roll in water and squeeze out well.
Place parsley in mixing bowl and chop <b>3 sec/speed 8<b>. Transfer to a bowl and set aside.
Place onions in mixing bowl and chop <b>3 sec/speed 5<b>. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add squeezed bread roll, egg, beef mince, mustard, salt, pepper, paprika powder and chopped parsley and mix <b>30 sec//speed 4<b> with aid of spatula.

Press ⅛ mince mixture flat in your hand, place a piece of cheddar at the centre, closing mince around it. Press down firmly so that the cheese cannot leak out during frying and carefully shape into a flat burger patty (Ø approx. 10 cm). Repeat for 7 other burgers.
Heat oil in a large non-stick frying pan. Fry beef burgers for approx. 3–4 minutes on either side until golden and serve hot.

hintsAndTricks: Serving suggestion: toast burger rolls in oven or toaster so they are nice and crisp. Spread e.g. ketchup or a dip of your choice on two roll halves, place beef burger on bottom half of roll, add lettuce, coleslaw or pickled gherkin to taste, place top half of roll on top and serve.
Replace the cheddar cheese with feta cheese.
